thread.title: Area volleyball teams learn regional pairings
thread.title_full: Area volleyball teams learn regional pairings

title: Area volleyball teams learn regional pairings
text:
Area volleyball teams learn regional pairings Published: Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 10:30 a.m. CDT By Jocelyn Sheets Newton Daily News 
Newton High’s Cardinals will host a first-round match in Class 4A volleyball regional action later this month. It will be against a familiar foe — fellow Little Hawkeye Conference member Grinnell. 
The Iowa Girls High School Athletic Union released the 2015 volleyball regional pairings Thursday afternoon. Class 1A regional play begins Oct. 20 while 4A and 3A’s first round matches are Oct. 26. 
Newton is in the Class 4A Region 4 along with Grinnell, Oskaloosa and Pella — all LHC teams — and Knoxville and Fairfield. Fairfield and Pella are currently ranked No. 10 and No. 11, respectively, in the new IGHSAU 4A poll. 
Collins-Maxwell/Baxter’s Raiders and Prairie City-Monroe’s Mustangs are in Class 3A Region 4. Both will be on the road in the first round of regional play. CMB is at North Polk and PCM goes to Saydel, all Heart of Iowa Conference teams. Nevada, which is ranked No. 3 in 3A, Clarke and Chariton round out the field. 
Lynnville-Sully’s Hawks and Colfax-Mingo’s Tigerhawks are in the Class 1A Region 5 14-team field. Colfax-Mingo received a first-round bye but will play on the road in the second road. Current top-ranked Janesville is in the other half of the bracket. 
There are five South Iowa Cedar League teams in the top half of the bracket — Lynnville-Sully, Colfax-Mingo, Iowa Valley, Montezuma and Belle Plaine. Along with Janesville in the bottom half are Gladbrook-Reinbeck, AGWSR, Colo-NESCO, Meskwaki Settlement School, North Tama and GMG. 
In Newton’s 4A regional, the Cardinals play Grinnell at home Oct. 26. The winner goes to Pella for a semifinal match Oct. 29. Knoxville plays at Oskaloosa in the first round and the winner plays at Fairfield Oct. 29. The championship match is Nov. 3 at Oskaloosa. All matches begin at 7 p.m. 
In 3A Region 3 play, the opening round matches are Oct. 26. CMB travels to Alleman to play North Polk and the winner takes on the winner of the Nevada and West Marshall match. The semifinal will be played at Nevada on Oct. 29. 
PCM takes on Saydel on Oct. 26 and the winner plays the winner of Clarke at Chariton. That semifinal match is at Chariton on Oct. 29. The Class 3A Region 3 title match is Nov. 11 at Newton. All matches begin at 7 p.m. 
First-round matches in Class 1A Region 5 are Oct. 20. Lynnville-Sully travels to Marengo to play Iowa Valley and Montezuma is at Belle Plaine. Winners of those matches play in round two Oct. 27 at Marengo. Ankeny Christian plays HLV at Victor in the first round and the winner plays Colfax-Mingo at Victor on Oct. 27. The semifinal is Oct. 30 at Marengo. 
Janesville received the first-round bye in the bottom half of the 1A Region 5 bracket. It will host the winner of Gladbrook-Reinbeck on Oct. 27. Colo-NESCO hosts Meskwaki in the first round at Colo and North Tama hosts GMG in Traer — both matches are on Oct. 20. The winners face off at Colo on Oct. 27. The semifinal match is Oct. 30 at Janesville. 
The Class 1A Region 5 title match is Nov. 4 in Reinbeck. All matches in the regional begin at 7 p.m. 
Regional champions advance to the 2015 IGHSAU State Volleyball Tournament, Nov. 10-13 at the U.S. Cellular Center in Cedar Rapids.
